attributes.comment:
The fees for N-600 and N-600A should not be increased. For those in adoption
processes, the waiting time is taking longer and longer. The I-171H expires and
people are having to pay twice nowadays. Then, because our children are
actually citizens upon arrival in the U.S., the fee for the Certificate of Citizenship is
high enough and really shouldn't be necessary for our kids. Even so, drastically
increasing the fees on this form adds insult to injury. Our kids should have been
given documentation upon arrival in the U.S. due to the Child Citizenship Act of
2000 and we should not have to pay for the COC. Please don't drive fees up any
higher on adoptive parents. I currenty have my daughter's application in right now
to avoid the higher fees. I will then have to wait up to a year to get a document
telling everyone my rightful U.S. citizen daugher is actually a U.S. citizen. You
will discourage future adoptions for families because the fees are just getting out
of hand and a child will go without a forever family. It's a real shame.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Parent, Kelly Nice
